memberdef.name: average_biinvariant

briefdescription.para: Compute an average point on Lie groups given a list of 'close' points.

parameterdescription.para: A list of 'close' points to compute an average point from.
norm threshold to break the iterative averaging.
number of iterations.

simplesect.para: The average point of the input points.

see (a) "Bi-invariant Means in Lie Groups. Application to Left-in variant Polyaffine Transformations" p. 21 Sec. 4.2 see also (b) "A globally convergent numerical algorithm for computing the center of mass on compact Lie groups." http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.721.8010&rep=rep1&type=pdf

memberdef.argsstring: (const Container< LieGroup, Args... > &points, typename LieGroup::Scalar eps=Constants< typename LieGroup::Scalar >::eps, int max_iterations=20)

memberdef.name: computeBezierCurve

briefdescription.para: Curve fitting using the DeCasteljau algorithm on Lie groups.

parameterdescription.para: discretized trajectory.
degree of smoothness of the fitted curve.
number of points to interpolate between two consecutive points of the trajectory. interpolate k_interp for t in ]0,1].
Whether the input trajectory is closed or not. If true, the first and the last points of the input trajectory are used to interpolate points inbetween. Default false.

simplesect.para: A naive implementation of the DeCasteljau algorithm on Lie groups.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< LieGroup > &trajectory, const unsigned int degree, const unsigned int k_interp, const bool closed_curve=false)

briefdescription.para: Constexpr function to compute the Bernstein polynomial.
Slerp interpolation. @detail Interpolate a point mc between ma and mb at t in [0,1]. mc=ma if t=0 mc=mb if t=1.

parameterdescription.para: Initial point.
Final Point.
Time at which to interpolate in [0,1].
J_mc_ma Jacobian of the interpolated point wrt ma.
J_mc_mb Jacobian of the interpolated point wrt mb.
